meanings.definition: A person regarded as effeminate or cowardly.
meanings.sent1: The boy was teased for being a sissy at school.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a sissy, stand up for yourself!
meanings.sent3: The little dog barked loudly, trying to prove he wasn't a sissy.
meanings.sent4: Her delicate, sissy nature made her an easy target for bullies.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was portrayed as a sissy, always running away from danger.

meanings.definition: A person who is timid or easily scared.
meanings.sent1: The sissy refused to go on the roller coaster.
meanings.sent2: The little girl was called a sissy for being afraid of spiders.
meanings.sent3: The big tough guy turned out to be a sissy when faced with a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: His sissy behavior in haunted houses always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent5: The dark forest made even the bravest knight feel like a sissy.
